Description: Body sherd (mended from two fragments) of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black with traces of two added white bands; exterior: painted decoration consisting of frieze of geese walking to right (part of first goose's head and feet missing; only ends of the wing feathers of second goose remaining); dotted circles and swastika as filling ornament.
Producer name: Attributed to: Group of the Würzburg Chalices
Curator's comments: Lemos places this sherd in the Würzburg Chalice Group. The sherds from this group display stylistic similarities to the two Würzburg chalices (Lemos 1991, pl. 20-1, no. 236-7).
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 71, p. 236, no. 153, pl. 14)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0153) (phase 2)
